meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or characteristic of divine providence.
meanings.sent1: The providential guidance led them safely through the storm.
meanings.sent2: It was providential that they found the lost dog before dark.
meanings.sent3: The providential timing of the rain saved the farmer's crops.
meanings.sent4: Her providential arrival at the meeting turned the tide of the discussion.
meanings.sent5: The providential intervention of a stranger changed the course of their journey.

meanings.definition: Occurring at a favorable time; opportune.
meanings.sent1: The providential arrival of the bus prevented them from getting wet in the rain.
meanings.sent2: It was providential that they finished the project right before the deadline.
meanings.sent3: The providential timing of the traffic lights allowed them to reach the airport on time.
meanings.sent4: His providential decision to bring an umbrella saved him from the sudden downpour.
meanings.sent5: The providential opportunity to meet the CEO boosted her career.

meanings.definition: Resulting from or seeming to result from divine intervention.
meanings.sent1: The providential healing of the sick child amazed the doctors.
meanings.sent2: It felt providential that they stumbled upon the hidden treasure.
meanings.sent3: The providential appearance of a rainbow made the gloomy day brighter.
meanings.sent4: Her providential escape from the burning building was nothing short of miraculous.
meanings.sent5: The providential sign in the sky filled them with hope and gratitude.
